plugins.name: WCAG Line Length
plugins.description:
Make your text more accessible with automatic line length optimization.


This plugin helps you comply with WCAG 2.2 Success Criterion 1.4.8, which recommends limiting line lengths to 80 characters or less. Long lines of text can be difficult to read and navigate, especially for users with cognitive disabilities or visual impairments.


📐 Key features:

  1. Check text elements against WCAG guidelines
  2. Automatically fix line lengths by adding strategic line breaks
  3. Works with any text layer or text box
  4. Supports multiple text selections
  5. Preserves your original text styling


💬 How to use:

  1. Select any text layers you want to check
  2. Click "Check Selection" to identify issues
  3. Click "Fix" to automatically adjust line lengths


Perfect for:

  1. UX/UI designers
  2. Accessibility specialists
  3. Content designers
  4. Anyone creating accessible digital experiences


Stay compliant with accessibility standards while maintaining clean, readable designs.
plugins.tagline: "Make your designs accessible by optimizing text line lengths to WCAG standards"

plugins.name: SF Symbol Generator
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin to generate static or variable SF Symbol SVGs from your Figma icons that can be imported into the SF Symbols App or directly to Xcode as an asset.

Compatible with SF Symbols 5 and up.


Features

- Convert a single Figma icon to an SF Symbol SVG

- Create variable SF Symbols from three icons (Ultra Light, Regular, and Black)

- Simple interface for selecting icons and assigning weights

- Dynamic attribution in SVG exports with plugin name and version

- Compatible with SF Symbols 5 and later versions

- Smart naming based on parent component or frame names

- The icons width will also be respected in the SF Symbol SVG accordingly

- Interactive SVG Preview with path direction visualization


Usage

1. Select one or more icon layers in your Figma document

2. Open the SF Symbol Generator plugin

3. Click "Scan Selected Icons" to detect your selected icons

4. Choose between Static or Variable mode:

- Static: Select one icon from your selection to create an SF Symbol

- Variable: Assign your icons to Ultra Light, Regular, and Black weights

5. Click "Create SF Symbol" to generate your SF Symbol SVG

accepted.name: Dustin K
accepted.description: A product designer based in Berlin, creating a powerful creative editor at IMG.LY.

plugins.tagline: Generate custom "static" or "variable" SF Symbols directly from Figma.

plugins.name: Figma Color Gradients

Explore the endless possibilities of color gradients in Figma. From subtle shifts to bold blends, Figma's intuitive tools make it easy to create eye-catching visuals for any project.


Figma's robust gradient features allow you to craft beautiful color blends for backgrounds, shapes, text, and more. Experiment with linear, radial, angular, and diamond gradients, and fine-tune your colors with precision using the color picker and gradient sliders. Designing with gradients has never been easier. Figma's user-friendly interface lets you quickly and effortlessly apply and customize gradients, making your workflow smooth and efficient.

plugins.name: Nong’s Handoff Tools
plugins.description:
Usage:

  1. Connect Pages: Select two Frames that need to be linked. In the plugin panel, choose the direction for the outgoing lines of the two Frames, then click the “Link” button to create the connection.
  2. Add Text Annotations: Select the element that needs an annotation. Click the button in the plugin panel to generate a number and text annotation.
  3. Draw Flowchart: Click the button to generate an element individually. Alternatively, select an existing element and then click the button to connect it to the selected element.
  4. Change Background Color: Click the “Page” button to change the color of the page. Select a Section and click the “Section” button to change the Section’s color. Click the “Area” button to directly generate a Frame for a separate Area.



使用方式：

  1. 连接页面：选择两个需要连线的Frame，在插件面板上选择两个Frame 出线的方向，点击Link按钮，即可连线。
  2. 添加文字备注：选择需要备注的元素，在插件面板上点击按钮，即可生成序号和文字。
  3. 绘制流程图：单独点击按钮可单独生成元素。也可先选择某个元素，再点击按钮，则会连接到选择的元素上。
  4. 背景色更改：直接点击Page按钮会更改Page的颜色。选择Section，点击Section按钮，则会修改Section颜色。点击Area按钮，会直接生成一个单独Area的Frame。
plugins.tagline: Connect & Description & Flow & Background

plugins.name: design-tokens.io Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
This is the Figma plugin for design-tokens.io


design-tokens.io is the real-time hub for your Design Tokens.


Ensure design consistency across multiple brands, themes and projects.

Accelerate release cycles through seamless handoffs between designers and developers.

Built for agencies and enterprise design teams.


Consistency across all brands

Keep a single source of truth for all your Design Tokens. All your themes stay 100% interchangable, by default.


Seamless import & export

Import and export your Design Tokens as W3C-compliant JSON. Avoid vendor lock-in.


Real-time collaboration

Multiple users manage Design Tokens, themes and brands at the same time. No workflow bottlenecks, no data conflicts.


Bridge design and development

Designers sync their Design Tokens with Figma variables in real-time. Developers receive CSS/SASS variables. No manual handoffs necessary.



FAQs


What if I already use Figma Variables?

That’s fine! Our platform natively supports Figma Variables while protecting you from their limited scalability and interoperability. It acts as a single-source-of-truth for all your Design Tokens and integrates with all your tools, not just Figma.


I only use the free Figma plan. Will this work for me?

Yes! Our Figma plugin works with every Figma plan, even the free one. It lets you import your Design Tokens into Figma and sync your changes in real-time, no matter how many tokens, themes and brands you manage.


Why not use Tokens Studio?

Tokens Studio is great, but it is primarily a Figma plugin - intended to be used by Figma users from within Figma. It even stores all your Design Tokens inside Figma.

Our platform takes the opposite approach: It is a standalone, single-purpose data hub that lets your whole team collaborate on your Design Tokens and syncs them to all your tools, not just Figma.


We're already using Supernova. Is this compatible?

Absolutely! You can start using our platform in tandem with Supernova today, since Supernova will import your Design Tokens from Figma as usual. We're also working on a native Supernova hook that will make the process even more seamless!


Is the platform W3C-compliant?

Yes! Our platform ensures maximum interoperability with all your other tools by being fully compliant with the latest version of the W3C Design Tokens specification. You can seamlessly import and export Design Tokens as W3C DTCG JSON.


What's the learning curve for my team?

Our platform is reportedly much easier to use than comparable tools and was designed from the ground up to make managing and accessing Design Tokens as simple as possible.

You will be up and running in a matter of minutes. Watch demo
plugins.tagline: Auto-sync your Design Tokens from design-tokens.io to Figma

AutoRenamer – AI-Powered Layer Naming for Figma 🚀


✨ Say Goodbye to Messy Layer Names!

Tired of manually renaming layers in Figma? AutoRenamer uses AI to analyze images, understand layer context, and automatically assign meaningful names—making your designs more structured & organized!

plugins.name: Multi-Link Copy
plugins.description:
Multi-Link Copy


Multi-Link Copy is designed to streamline the process of copying multiple frame or component links at once. If you're working on a large-scale design project, you may need to share or document the locations of multiple frames or components within a your file.


Instead of manually copying each link one by one, this plugin allows you to select multiple components or frames and generate their links in bulk. The links are copied to your clipboard in separate lines, making it easy to paste them into a spreadsheet, text file, or any document where you need to store or share those links.


What the Plugin Does:


Batch Copying of Links:

  1. The plugin generates URLs for selected components or frames within the current Figma file.
  2. Each link is a direct reference to the specific node (frame or component) inside the Figma file.
  3. These links are copied to your clipboard and can be pasted into any document, where each URL will appear on its own line in the order of your layer hierarchy in your Figma file (top layers first).


Use Case:

  1. When you need to share links to multiple frames or components in one go, especially for documentation, design reviews, developer hand-offs, or tracking design updates.
  2. Useful for project managers, designers, and developers who need quick access to the location of specific elements within a Figma file.


---


How to Use the Plugin:


1. Enter Figma File URL

  1. After launching the plugin, you will be prompted to enter the URL of your Figma file.
  2. This is required to extract the file key that’s necessary for generating URLs for the selected frames or components.
  3. This data is used temporarily by the plugin and never saved, read, or accessed by anyone.
  4. To get the URL, open the Figma file in your browser and copy the link from the address bar. It should look something like: https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/Your-File-Name.


2. Selecting Elements

  1. Select the components, frames, or any other nodes you want to generate links for.


3. Copy Links

  1. Click "Copy Links" and a notification will appear confirming how many links were copied.
  2. The links are already copied to your clipboard, formatted one per line.


4. Paste Links

  1. Go to any document where you want to paste the links (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets, Notion, Slack, etc.).
  2. Each link will populate a new line or row in the document in the order of your layers in Figma (top layers first).


5. Celebrate 🎉


---


What You Can Expect:


Fast Bulk Link Generation: Select as many frames or components as needed, and the plugin will generate URLs for all selected items instantly.


Easy Copy and Paste: Once the plugin runs, the links are automatically copied to the clipboard. You don’t need to open a separate window or click additional buttons. Simply paste the links wherever needed.


---


Example Output


After running the plugin, if you've selected 3 components, pasting into a document will give something like this:


https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/?node-id=123:456

https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/?node-id=789:1011

https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/?node-id=112:1314


Each URL points directly to the specific frame or component within the Figma file.


---


Limitations:


The plugin needs the Figma file URL to extract the fileKey, which is a unique identifier for your Figma file. The fileKey allows it to accurately generate direct links to the frames or components you select.


The URL is only used temporarily to retrieve this key, ensuring privacy and security. The plugin does not store any information. Keep in mind, only users with access to your files can view or use the generated links.


About fileKeys: A fileKey is part of the URL that uniquely identifies each Figma file. It's essential for referencing the correct file when generating links for components or frames. To understand more about how fileKeys work and where they are located in your Figma URL, you can visit Figma's documentation here.
plugins.tagline: Batch copy mutliple frame links at a time

plugins.name: Frame Inspector
plugins.description:
Frame Inspector is a powerful Figma plugin designed to enhance your workflow by simplifying frame management. With Frame Inspector, you can effortlessly select multiple frames and instantly interpret their widths, while automatically adding device labels and pixel measurements to their names. Say goodbye to manual labeling and tedious calculations!


Simply select the desired frames, and Frame Inspector will analyze their widths and append the appropriate labels to their names, indicating whether they represent a mobile device, tablet, or desktop view.


Additionally, the plugin displays the precise width measurement in pixels, making it easier than ever to identify and organize frames according to their intended display context.

plugins.name: Clickma: ClickUp to Figma Sync
plugins.description:
Clickma eliminates rework and duplication by keeping design and project documentation seamlessly aligned in one unified workflow. It ties relevant ClickUp tickets directly to the Figma sections referenced, so Designers, Developers, Product Managers, and QAs can easily find what they need. See a video demo here.


Some key features include:

  1. Ticket import: Display Clickup Tickets in your Figma canvas.
  2. Jump to ticket: See all imported tickets in a list and jump to their location in your figma file.
  3. Search ticket in list view: Basic users can search by title and Clickup ID. Premium users can also search by Clickup status or assignee.
  4. DevMode Compatible: DevMode users can jump to ticket and see the list view.
  5. Sync tickets: Basic users can sync tickets individually, while Premium users can bulk sync tickets with just 1-click.
  6. Ticket link (premium): Open your tickets in your browser from list view, DevMode or the tickets you import.
  7. Edit tickets (premium): Edit ticket title, status and description within Figma and sync back to ClickUp.


Check more details our website clickma.tech


We are in active development, if you have suggestions for improvement, feedback or need help please contact us at support@clickma.tech

plugins.name: Token Code -  (Css, Tailwind, Typescript, Shopify, Swift, Android)
plugins.description:
This app takes your Figma design tokens, such as color, typography, effect, and spacing, and generates code outputs in over 10 different formats, including CSS, SCSS, Tailwind, TypeScript, Shopify Liquid, Swift, and more. Additionally, it allows you to export Local Styles definitions as CSS. Designed to streamline your design-to-code workflow, it’s an essential tool for designers and developers alike.


How Does It Work?

1.Select either Local Variables or Local Styles to begin.

2.Choose the tokens you want to generate code for.

3.Pick your desired output format (e.g., CSS, Tailwind).

4.Hit the Copy button to get your code.


That’s it! Transforming your tokens into ready-to-use code is now just a few clicks away.


Additional Highlights

•User-Friendly: The simple interface makes it easy for anyone to use, regardless of their experience level.

•Broad Format Support: With over 10 output formats, it seamlessly integrates into any workflow or technology stack.

•Time-Saving: Quickly bridge the gap between design and development, saving you hours of manual work.


This app is the perfect bridge between design and code. Take your design tokens to development with just one click and supercharge your workflow! 🚀



This app is completely free! It’s designed to make your workflow faster and easier. If you find it helpful, feel free to leave a review, like, or share it with others.

If you encounter any issues, you can reach out to me directly via X ❤️

plugins.name: Onyx ◆ Design System to Code
plugins.description:
Onyx ◆ Design System to Code


◆ Overview


Onyx is designed to simplify the workflow between design and development by automating the conversion of your Figma Design System into ready-to-use Vue components. Its ability to handle multiple selected component variants and integrate design tokens provided via the Tokens Studio for Figma plugin makes it a powerful tool for modern web development.


Onyx is a Figma plugin designed to efficiently translate Figma Design Systems into Vue components, utilizing UnoCSS utility classes. This tool targets developers and designers looking to streamline the conversion of their design systems into functional, reactive UI components directly usable in Vue projects.


Project is open source:

https://github.com/onyx-gen/onyx



◆ What It Does


  • Figma Components to Vue Components: Onyx allows users to select components within Figma and generate corresponding Vue components. Design properties are translated to UnoCSS utility classes.


  • Support for Design Tokens: The plugin integrates with Tokens Studio, another Figma plugin, to convert design tokens into CSS variables. These variables are then passed to the UnoCSS utility classes (e.g., background color design token named primary.bg.hover generates the bg-$primary.bg.hover UnoCSS utility class)


  • Multi-Variant Component Support: Users can select multiple variants of a component (such as default, hover, and focused) and Onyx will generate a single Vue component. Onyx automatically applies the correct UnoCSS variants (e.g., bg-red-600 hover:bg-red-700 focus:bg-red-800)


  • Live Preview: Onyx provides a real-time preview of the generated Vue components within Figma via an iframe. This feature ensures that components are visually and functionally in sync with the Figma design.



◆ How to Use It


  1. Select Components: Start by selecting one or multiple components within your Figma design system.
  2. Open the Onyx Figma plugin: Open the Onyx Figma plugin in Figma's plugin panel.
  3. Generate Code: Onyx automatically generates Vue components for the selected Figma components.
  4. Implement in Project: Copy the generated Vue component into your Vue project.



◆ Limitations


  • Work in Progress: As the plugin is still under development, some design properties may not convert perfectly into UnoCSS utility classes. At the moment not all design tokens types can be applied.


  • Design Compatibility: There may be limitations in how certain Figma design properties translate to UnoCSS utility classes, potentially requiring manual adjustments.
plugins.tagline: Components & Design Tokens → Vue & UnoCSS

86524.name: Onyx ◆ Design System to Code
86524.description:

◆ Overview


Onyx is designed to simplify the workflow between design and development by automating the conversion of your Figma Design System into ready-to-use Vue components. Onyx is a Figma plugin designed to efficiently translate Figma Design Systems into Vue components, utilizing UnoCSS utility classes. This tool targets developers and designers looking to streamline the conversion of their design systems into functional, reactive UI components directly usable in Vue projects.


Project is open source:

https://github.com/onyx-gen/onyx



◆ What It Does


  • Figma Components to Vue Components: Onyx allows users to select components within Figma and generate corresponding Vue components. Design properties are translated to UnoCSS utility classes.


  • Support for Design Tokens: The plugin integrates with Tokens Studio, another Figma plugin, to convert design tokens into CSS variables. These variables are then passed to the UnoCSS utility classes (e.g., background color design token named primary.bg.hover generates the bg-$primary.bg.hover UnoCSS utility class)


  • Multi-Variant Component Support: Users can select multiple variants of a component (such as default, hover, and focused) and Onyx will generate a single Vue component. Onyx automatically applies the correct UnoCSS variants (e.g., bg-red-600 hover:bg-red-700 focus:bg-red-800)


  • Live Preview: Onyx provides a real-time preview of the generated Vue components within Figma via an iframe. This feature ensures that components are visually and functionally in sync with the Figma design.



◆ How to Use It


  1. Select Components: Start by selecting one or multiple components within your Figma design system.
  2. Open the Onyx Figma plugin: Open the Onyx Figma plugin in Figma's plugin panel.
  3. Generate Code: Onyx automatically generates Vue components for the selected Figma components.
  4. Implement in Project: Copy the generated Vue component into your Vue project.



◆ Limitations


  • Work in Progress: As the plugin is still under development, some design properties may not convert perfectly into UnoCSS utility classes. At the moment not all design tokens types can be applied.


  • Design Compatibility: There may be limitations in how certain Figma design properties translate to UnoCSS utility classes, potentially requiring manual adjustments.

plugins.name: Table text plugin
plugins.description:
Description

The Table text plugin allows designers to streamline the process of populating table components in Figma with comma-delimited data. Users can paste their data directly into the plugin’s interface, and the plugin will parse and populate the corresponding text layers in table cells. If additional rows are required, the plugin dynamically generates them based on the input data, ensuring a seamless fit within the existing table structure.


Key features

  1. Data input: Easily paste comma-delimited data into the provided text area. Supports handling data with embedded commas by using double quotes (" ") as delimiters.
  2. Dynamic row creation: Automatically generates new rows if the input data exceeds the existing table row count in Figma.
  3. Header matching: Maps data headers to corresponding Figma table cells based on their names, ensuring precise data alignment.
  4. Text layer updates: Identifies text layers named text within table cells and updates their content with the provided data.
  5. Guided setup: Includes a detailed Readme section to help users format data correctly and prepare their Figma file for efficient use of the plugin.


Best practices

  1. Prepare data in tools like Google Sheets and export it to a comma-delimited format.
  2. Ensure table headers in Figma match the column names in the data for accurate mapping.
  3. Define rows as local components in Figma and name them sequentially (e.g., Row 1, Row 2).


How to videos

I've created a series of video walkthrough to accompany the Figma playground file to highlight how the plugin works and how best to utilise it.

  1. Introduction
  2. Walkthrough
  3. Demo


Use the playground file to play with the capabilities of the plugin, as shown in the videos above.


This plugin simplifies data handling for table-based designs, saving time and ensuring consistency in Figma projects.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly transform CSV data into Figma table rows

plugins.name: CSS Color Extrator
plugins.description:
CSS Color Extractor

CSS Color Extractor es una herramienta intuitiva que te permite extraer todos los colores CSS utilizados en cualquier sitio web con solo ingresar la URL. Simplifica el proceso de recoger y reutilizar colores de otros sitios para tus proyectos, ya sea que necesites inspiración de una paleta ya existente o simplemente quieras analizar los tonos usados en una página.


Características Principales:

  1. Extracción Rápida desde una URL: Introduce la URL de cualquier sitio web y extrae todos los colores CSS utilizados, incluyendo variables declaradas en en el root.
  2. Copiado Manual: También puedes pegar manualmente las declaraciones CSS del inspector de tu navegador para obtener los colores.
  3. Identificación y Copiado Fácil: Copia los valores hexadecimales o las variables CSS con un solo clic.
  4. Interfaz Amigable: Diseñada con una interfaz limpia y amigable que hace que la experiencia sea intuitiva y eficiente.
  5. Ideal para Diseñadores y Desarrolladores: Si buscas una forma rápida de identificar paletas de colores en la web, CSS Color Extractor es perfecto para ayudarte a ahorrar tiempo.


¿Cómo usarlo?

  1. Ingresa la URL de la página web de la cual deseas extraer los colores, o copia y pega las declaraciones CSS.
  2. Presiona el botón "EXTRAER COLORES" y obtén todos los colores utilizados.
  3. Selecciona cualquier color para ver su código hex o nombre de variable CSS, y cópialo fácilmente al portapapeles.
plugins.tagline: Extrae la paleta de colores de un sitio web

plugins.name: Spagett!
plugins.description:
Spagett is here to spook you! Get ready to see Spagett everywhere.

When executing the plugin there's two possible scenarios:

1. Some layers is selected: Spagett will be added as a fill to every selected layer.
2. No layer is selected: Spagett will be added as a fill to every layer that already has a fill in the page.

(Some context https://youtu.be/uyh3C1xDT3Y)

The code for this plugin is open sourced at GitHub
https://github.com/aarongarciah/figma-spagett

Made with ❤️ by Aarón García
https://twitter.com/aarongarciah

plugins.name: vibe working
plugins.description: Vibe Working is a Figma plugin that lets you listen to lofi beats while designing. It features a minimal YouTube-powered music player with a curated playlist of chillhop, jazz, morning, and night lofi tracks. Users can switch playlists, play/pause, skip tracks, and toggle between light & dark mode for a seamless mood experience. The plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing designers to stay focused and relaxed without leaving their workflow. With zero distractions and smooth UI controls, Vibe Working creates the perfect ambient workspace for creative professionals.
plugins.tagline: Design. Focus. Vibe –  productive music beats for your creative flow, a perfect ambient workspace.

plugins.name: AutoSpec
plugins.description:
Quickly apply focus areas in your layout, identifying roles/semantics, following WCAG rules.


In this version you can:

  • Work with multiple screens simultaneously
  • Add focus areas
  • Switch between two supported languages ​​(Portuguese and English)
  • Edit roles/semantics via JSON code

  • Jonas de Oliveira Fernandes - Especialista em acessibilidade
